intro: Canistropsis burchellii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine pubescence. Canistropsis burchellii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
